verses.verse: And He who sat there was (Matt. 5:8; Rev. 21:11) like a jasper and a sardius stone in appearance; (Gen. 9:13-17; Ezek. 1:28; Rev. 10:1) and there was a rainbow around the throne, in appearance like an emerald.
(Rev. 11:16) Around the throne were twenty-four thrones, and on the thrones I saw twenty-four elders sitting, (Rev. 3:4, 5) clothed in white robes; and they had crowns of gold on their heads.

And from the throne proceeded (Gen. 49:9, 10; Ex. 19:16; Rev. 8:5; 11:19; 16:18) lightnings, thunderings, and voices. (Ex. 37:23) Seven lamps of fire were burning before the throne, which are (2 Sam. 7:12; (Rev. 1:4)) the seven Spirits of God.

Before the throne there was (Ex. 38:8; Ezek. 1:22; Rev. 15:2) a sea of glass, like crystal. (Ezek. 1:5; Rev. 4:8; 5:6; 6:1, 6; 7:11; 14:3; 15:7; 19:4) And in the midst of the throne, and around the throne, were four living creatures full of eyes in front and in back.

(Ezek. 1:10; 10:14) The first living creature was like a lion, the second living creature like a calf, the third living creature had a face like a man, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.

The four living creatures, each having (Is. 6:2) six wings, were full of eyes around and within. And they do not rest day or night, saying: (Is. 6:3) “Holy, holy, holy, (Rev. 1:8) Lord God Almighty, (Rev. 1:4) Who was and is and is to come!”
Whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to Him who sits on the throne, (Rev. 1:18) who lives forever and ever,
(Rev. 5:8, 14; 7:11; 11:16; 19:4) the twenty-four elders fall down before Him who sits on the throne and worship Him who lives forever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying:
“You (Rev. 1:6; 5:12) are worthy, O Lord, To receive glory and honor and power; (Gen. 1:1; John 1:3) For You created all things, And by (Col. 1:16) Your will they exist and were created.”
The Lamb Takes the Scroll And I saw in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne (Ezek. 2:9, 10) a scroll written inside and on the back, (Is. 29:11; Dan. 12:4) sealed with seven seals.
Then I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, (Rev. 4:11; 5:9) “Who is worthy to open the scroll and to loose its seals?”
And no one in heaven or on the earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll, or to look at it.
So I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open and read the scroll, or to look at it.

But one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. Behold, (Gen. 49:9) the Lion of the tribe of (Heb. 7:14) Judah, (Is. 11:1, 10; Rom. 15:12; Rev. 22:16) the Root of David, has (Rev. 3:21) prevailed to open the scroll (Rev. 6:1) and to loose its seven seals.”
